translation.en: [announcer] And it's Rockin' With Dewey continuing to race in second.
Then comes Masherhal, Hand Over Bell and Perfect Alliance
translation.ko: "NETFLIX 제공" 마셔홀, 핸드 오버 벨 퍼펙트 얼라이언스가

translation.en: is still at the back of the field in 56 and 3/5 seconds.
And now MF Happenstance leads the charge around the far turn.
MF Happenstance, three quarters of a length.
Mystery Woman second on the outside,
Rockin' With Dewey is third to the inside.
And they're being followed by Hand Over Bell, Masherhal,
translation.ko: 핸드 오버 벨, 마셔홀이 이들 뒤를 따르고

translation.en: and Perfect Alliance is still at the back.
And they're into the stretch, three quarters in 1:24.2.
And it is still MF Happenstance,
and here comes Mystery Woman to the outside.
-And in the center, Hand Over Bell... -No.
translation.ko: - 가운데에는 핸드 오버 벨 - 안 돼

translation.en: Come on.
[announcer] It is Mystery Woman, Hand Over Bell on the far outside.
translation.ko: 미스터리 우먼 핸드 오버 벨이 바깥쪽!

translation.en: -Masherhal is closing late... -[man] Come on, Mashy.
[announcer] Here at the finish it's Hand Over Bell!
translation.ko: 결승선을 통과하는 건 핸드 오버 벨!

translation.en: -[man 2] Yeah, I got it. -Masherhal was next,
then came Rockin' With Dewey
and Mystery Woman in 1:51.4.
I'm starting.
No, we wait for him.
Hello?
[computer] You have a collect call from the Atlantic County Correctional Facility
translation.ko: 애틀랜틱 카운티 교도소에서 수신자 부담 전화가 왔습니다

translation.en: -from... -[recorded voice] Darren.
[computer] Press one to accept.
-Darren. -Hey.
-Where are you? -Jail.
Jesus. What did you do?
No, it's nothing. I've been trying to call you.
You didn't pay your fuckin' cell phone?
Yeah, I get paid on Monday. What happened?
translation.ko: 월요일에 급여 받아서 낼 거야 어떻게 된 거야?

translation.en: -I'm down in Atlantic City. -Ma.
Just some asshole, I ended up having to smash in his window.
translation.ko: 어떤 나쁜 새끼 집 창문을 깨버렸거든

translation.en: Misdemeanor. Point is, I'm stuck here. I gotta spend the night.
Which is why I need you to help me out. I got this thing going on here tomorrow...
translation.ko: 그래서 네가 도와줘야겠어 내일 할 일이 있으니

translation.en: so you gotta do it and pretend you're me.
You'll get in a guy's car and deliver a briefcase.
translation.ko: 어떤 남자 차에 타서 서류 가방 좀 배달해

translation.en: [Darren] Don't worry about anything.
There's $1,500 in it for me. You know I need it.
translation.ko: 1,500달러가 걸린 일이야 나 돈 필요하단 말이야

translation.en: All right? I'll be very proud of you.
-What's in the suitcase? -It's a briefcase.
translation.ko: - 여행 가방에 뭐가 들었는데? - 서류 가방이야

translation.en: What's in the briefcase?
I don't know.
No, I'm not doing-- You don't know?
It's just papers, man.
It's nothing major.
I'm not doing that.
-Put Ma on the phone. -No.
Danny!
-Put Ma on the phone. -[Ola speaking in Polish]
-[banging on door] -[conductor] Miss, I already told you,
if you don't have a ticket you'll have to get off the train.
translation.ko: 아가씨, 아까도 말했지만 승차권이 없으면 열차에서 내려야 해요

translation.en: Daniel...
Your brother needs you. You're doing it.
[Darren] Okay, look, just listen, all right?
There'll be a woman on a bench with a green purse.
translation.ko: 초록색 핸드백을 든 여자가 의자에 앉아 있을 거야

translation.en: And you swap your briefcase for hers.
translation.ko: 가져간 서류 가방을 그 여자 거랑 바꿔치면 돼

translation.en: -[Danny] Green purse. -You're not writing this down, are you?
translation.ko: - 초록색 핸드백 - 적고 있는 거 아니지?

translation.en: No.
Good. Don't be stupid, I really need this money.
translation.ko: 좋아, 멍청하게 굴지 말고 나 정말 이 돈이 절실해

translation.en: I owe you one, all right?
I'll pay your cell phone bill.
All right? She's got a green pocketbook and--
All right, but whose-- whose car am I getting into?
translation.ko: 알았어, 근데 어떤 차를 타는 거야?

translation.en: -What? -Wrap it up.
Just one sec. You just got to do this for me, okay?
I'm gonna do it. Who's the guy driving the car?
Promise me you'll do this. Danny? Promise me you'll do--
I'm doing it, but who's the guy driving the car?
You got a swipe? You got a swipe?
[man] There's this one guy, like, from Philly, I think.
They got like a Philly vibe, and, uh...
Russell and Jimmy know him.
Russell's been a big pain in the ass, but Jimmy gets it, you know?
translation.ko: 러셀은 짜증 나게 굴었지만 지미는 이해하지

translation.en: Like, he knows I can come through for him.
translation.ko: 내가 임무를 완수할 걸 잘 알아

translation.en: Shit's been weird since the bust, but this is a good situation
translation.ko: 불시 단속 이후 안 좋았지만 이번엔 상황이 좋아

translation.en: 'cause these guys, they're professional.
Not like Howie, that fuck. That guy doesn't know what he's doing.
translation.ko: 하위 같은 새끼랑은 달라 그 새끼는 아는 게 없잖아

translation.en: And the plan is intricate, you know what I mean?
translation.ko: 이번 계획은 복잡해 무슨 뜻인지 알지?

translation.en: It's like a clock, you know.
Everything fits together and everyone gets protected.
translation.ko: 모든 게 딱딱 들어맞고 위험에 빠질 일도 없지

translation.en: I want more money.
-No. -I'm driving.
I'm keeping the clock running.
What are you talking about? You came to me for work.
translation.ko: 무슨 소리야? 일 구해준 건 나잖아

translation.en: I mean, how'd you lose that job anyway?
translation.ko: 그나저나 전 직장은 왜 관둔 거야?

translation.en: Creative differences.
[chuckles] Really?
And how's, uh, Ricky's check cashing con paying off for you?
translation.ko: 리키의 수표 현금화 사기는 성과가 어땠는데?

translation.en: Because no one asked you to skip town to Pittsburgh
translation.ko: 그 멍청한 놈 때문에 피츠버그에 가라고

translation.en: for some greaseball shithead.
Yeah, well, he did.
I mean, if you don't go back to Pittsburgh,
translation.ko: 내 말은 네가 피츠버그로 안 돌아간다면...

translation.en: I have a... queen size bed.
You've done worse.
Well, I'm going back to Pittsburgh, so I'm fine on the couch, Scott.
translation.ko: 전 피츠버그로 돌아갈 거라 소파에서 자면 돼요, 스콧

translation.en: Just do the job.
This is the phone. Don't make any outgoing calls.
translation.ko: 이 휴대폰으로는 전화 걸지 말고 받기만 해

translation.en: And these are the keys to the Sentra.
-Thought you said it was an Altima. -It's a fuckin' Nissan. Doesn't matter.
translation.ko: - 닛산 알티마라고 했잖아요 - 닛산은 닛산이니 상관없잖아

translation.en: It's, like, uh, gonna be the only red Nissan on the block.
translation.ko: 그 구역에서 빨간 닛산은 이거 한 대일 거야

translation.en: -What's in the briefcase? -I don't know.
You can't know everything, Ellie.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 알 순 없어, 엘리

translation.en: Sometimes you gotta just do it.
Here you go.
Felicia, I can go?
Are you the guy?
Uh... yeah.
Yeah.
You the guy?
Yeah, I'm the girl.
Right.
I can see that.
Get in.
Do you know what the-- the-- the guy looks like?
translation.ko: 가방 주는 남자는 어떻게 생겼는지 알아요?

translation.en: No.
It is a guy, right?
Keep the car on.
Roll this back window down.
-[man shouting in distance] -He's coming back, he's coming back.
-Do you think they got the license plate? -I don't know.
Because, man...
Do you know who the girl is I gotta meet with the green bag?
translation.ko: 초록색 핸드백 멘 여자는 누군지 알아요?

translation.en: -Good luck. -All right.
Come on, man.
Yeah, it's done.
Oh, my God-- Oh, my God, it's you.
You don't even know what I just did.
Look, stop. Where are you goin'?
Look-- Don't run, don't run, don't run, please don't run.
I just need a number or something, I just need...
I don't know, an address or something, like...
You're not gonna help me?
I just gave the briefcase to the wrong woman.
Exactly. What are we gonna do?
What am I gonna do? I'm not supposed to be here.
translation.ko: 어떻게 하죠? 원래 나오기로 한 건

translation.en: I'm not even supposed to be here, it's my brother.
-Do you know my brother Darren? -Don't fucking tell me his name.
translation.ko: - 우리 형 대런 알아요? - 그 이름 말하지 말아요

translation.en: Why don't you wanna know?
Look, look! Look, you're not gonna get your 1,500 either, okay?
-1,500? -Yeah, 1,500. That's all I know.
-All I know is the green-- -They're paying you fuckin' $1,500?
translation.ko: - 제가 아는 건 초록색... - 1,500달러 준다고 했어요?

translation.en: I think so. I don't even know.
Give me your phone. Give me your fucking phone.
translation.ko: 전화기 좀 줘봐요 휴대폰 좀 달라고요

translation.en: I don't have a-- I didn't pay my bill.
What are we gonna do?
You got a quarter?
I got a phone card. You gonna call him?
You're calling him?
-Fuck. -This is not fucking rocket science.
How hard is it? You walk up to the fucking platform,
-you exchange the suitcase. -I know.
I got an eight-year-old that can do it.
You give it to this fuckin' Pollack, look what happens.
translation.ko: 폴란드 놈한테 일을 맡기니 결과가 어떤지 봐

translation.en: -You're so fucking stupid-- -Stop talking, Russell!
translation.ko: - 넌 정말 멍청해 - 입 좀 닫아, 러셀

translation.en: -Stop talking! -[cell phone ringing]
Hold up. Who's this?
-Well, hello there. -[man] I think we got a problem.
Yeah, no shit. $1,500, Scott?
Why is some idiot getting twice as much as me?
translation.ko: 왜 어떤 멍청이는 나보다 두 배를 받죠?

translation.en: -[Scott] He with you now? -Yes.
Do you have the thing?
No.
But I have the address where it's going.
I think we got it under control, okay? Just gonna take a little longer.
translation.ko: 해결할 수 있어요 시간이 좀 더 걸릴 뿐이죠

translation.en: It's fine. We got it under control.
It's gonna cost you.
[Scott] Okay. The full $1,500.
Twice that.
What the fuck do I care? It's comin' out of your share.
-Okay. -We need to see Darren, too.
And she brings Darren. I don't want him running around until this is done.
translation.ko: 일 끝날 때까지 대런도 데리고 다니라고 해

translation.en: Okay, so you deliver the thing and you bring him with you tonight.
translation.ko: 좋아, 물건 배달하고 오늘 밤에 대런하고 같이 와

translation.en: You can keep his share, too.
Okay. All right.
New Ebony Hotel, Room 1310, 10:00 p.m.
1310, got it. Let's go.
Wait, wait, you don't need me. You-- You got the address.
translation.ko: 잠깐만요, 주소 알았으니 나는 필요 없잖아요

translation.en: Take the bag, I don't want it anymore.
translation.ko: 이 가방 가져가요 난 이제 빠질래요

translation.en: What does the woman look like?
She's got blonde hair, she had a white shirt on.
-She's... -Yeah, exactly. Let's go.
[Ellie] What's the address on the pills again?
-[pills rattling] -31 Maryasis Road.
It's in Briarcliff.
[Ellie] Hi, what train goes to Briarcliff?
Ossining or Scarborough, whichever one is closer to you.
-Scarborough. -12:20, track 40.
Okay. Thank you.
You want to guess what my name is?
My name is Danny.
-Come on, tell me your name. -[scoffs] I'm not telling you my name.
translation.ko: - 그쪽 이름 말해줘요 - 안 말할 거예요

translation.en: All right. Where are you from?
Look, you fucked up, so you lost "knowing shit" privileges, all right?
translation.ko: 그쪽이 일을 망쳤으니 하나도 안 알려줄 겁니다

translation.en: -You know, you can be a real-- -A what? Huh?
-A real bitch? -What?
No, no.
I was-- I was gonna say you can be a tough nut to crack, but...
Were you really gonna say "a tough nut to crack"?
Yeah. Why, what's wrong with that?
I live in Pittsburgh.
How's Pittsburgh?
A lot of shitty people.
Oh. I'm sorry.
Don't be sorry. You didn't build it.
translation.ko: 그쪽이 만든 것도 아닌데 뭐가 미안해요

translation.en: So, you live with anyone in Pittsburgh?
You know, you got a roommate or, you know, you got a boyfriend?
I live with a Ricky.
What's a Ricky?
I had a lizard named Ricky once.
translation.ko: 예전에 제가 키우던 도마뱀 이름이 리키였죠

translation.en: [chuckles] Sounds about right.
Come on, you'll be done when it's done.
Who do you think lives out here?
Rich people.
So, how much do you think these houses cost?
-Why? You in the market? -Oh, no.
What about, uh, Sacramento? You ever been there?
No, thank God.
There's a job opening there.
'Cause I'm a chef, you know?
At a nice restaurant in the city.
You know what "farm to table" is, right?
I'm more of a cook, I guess.
Okay, sure, whatever, but you don't have to leave New York.
translation.ko: 뭐든 상관없지만 뉴욕을 떠날 필요 없잖아요

translation.en: Yeah, I know, but...
my living situation's not great.
translation.ko: 제가 사는 꼴이 별로 좋지 않아요

translation.en: Fine, but there's restaurants everywhere.
That's true.
So what about you? What do you do?
-I'm recently unemployed. -Oh, really?
What did you do?
I-- I was a bartender.
But I made-- I made, like, fancy cocktails.
That's cool. I got this friend Lev that I went to high school with,
he-- he's a bar-back in the city at this bar and he's just like...
His favorite drink to make is, like, these egg whites--
Look, I wasn't a bartender, okay? I worked in a strip club.
translation.ko: 사실 나 바텐더 아니었어요 스트립 클럽에서 일했죠

translation.en: All right. Okay.
I bet you were successful at that, you know.
-What the fuck's that supposed to mean? -Nothing, just 'cause--
translation.ko: - 그게 무슨 뜻이죠? - 별 뜻 없어요

translation.en: You're pretty and you're smart, and...
Well, I wasn't.
And I was only a waitress, okay? I didn't strip or work the back.
translation.ko: 전 웨이트리스였거든요 옷을 벗거나 뒤에서 일 안 했죠

translation.en: -All right. -I'm serious. I don't sleep around.
translation.ko: - 알았어요 - 난 몸 함부로 안 굴려요

translation.en: -What, you don't believe me? -I believe you.
-Guess how many guys I've slept with. -It doesn't matter--
translation.ko: - 내가 몇 명하고 잤나 맞혀봐요 - 상관없어요

translation.en: -No, no. Guess. -I'm not guessing, that's stupid.
translation.ko: - 얘기해 보라고요 - 그런 멍청한 짓 안 해요

translation.en: -I'm not gonna guess. -Seven.
-Okay. -It's not a lot.
It's not a lot. I probably would've said higher.
translation.ko: 안 많아요 전 더 높은 숫자 불렀을 겁니다

translation.en: Oh, so you're saying I look like a whore now?
No! I just...
I just-- I wouldn't even think you were a whore
if you slept with, like, a hundred guys.
Yeah, exactly.
-Who are you to judge me? -I'm not judging you.
translation.ko: - 그쪽이 뭔데 날 판단해요? - 판단 안 해요

translation.en: That's why I don't wanna guess.
We're lost.
-Uh, we shouldn't be. -No, I've seen that house before.
translation.ko: - 아닐 거예요 - 아뇨, 저 집 전에도 봤어요

translation.en: I don't know. Maybe you were here when you were a kid.
translation.ko: 글쎄요, 어쩌면 어릴 때 여기 왔었나 보죠

translation.en: You know, if that was the right left, then this is Maryasis.
translation.ko: 제대로 좌회전 한 거면 여기가 마르야시스 길이에요

translation.en: If they put up a fuckin' street sign we'd be able to tell.
translation.ko: 도로명 표지판을 세웠다면 알 수 있었을 거예요

translation.en: -Hey, what are you doing? -Looking for an address.
translation.ko: "466번지" - 뭐 하는 거예요? - 주소 좀 보려고요

translation.en: No, no, you can't do this, it's a federal crime.
Yeah, well, I got an accomplice.
Look, it is the right street.
Put it away.
Can I help you?
-Hey. Um, do you live here? -I do not.
-Neither do we. -No.
You don't look much like the Kutikoffs.
The Kutiko-- Yeah, uh-- We're supposed to just, you know...
-They're-- We're just... -We're just a little lost.
-We're just a little lost. -That's it.
You know what I do when I'm lost?
translation.ko: 내가 길을 잃으면 어떻게 하는 줄 알아요?

translation.en: I call the police. Shall I call them for you?
-No, no. -No, thanks. We're just gonna leave.
-Thank you. -[man] Good idea.
Sorry.
Don't worry about it. He's driving a fucking SUV.
translation.ko: 걱정하지 말아요 저 사람 SUV 몰잖아요

translation.en: -What does that mean? -He's an asshole.
I don't think anyone's home.
Hey. It's in the living room. Don't let the dog out.
translation.ko: 그거 거실에 있어요 개는 집에서 내보내지 말고요

translation.en: -Is that the girl that took the bag? -No, no. This girl is younger.
translation.ko: - 가방 가져간 여자예요? - 아뇨, 이 여자가 더 젊어요

translation.en: Uh, I guess.
I don't think she's talking about the briefcase.
translation.ko: 서류 가방 얘기한 게 아닌 듯해요

translation.en: I think we just have to find her and ask her.
Yeah. Yeah, let's do that.
Hello?
Hello?
Hey, look, it's a Ricky.
Oh, my God, check it out.
That's a big lizard.
I don't know why they give kids pets that die so young.
translation.ko: 왜 일찍 죽는 애완동물을 애들한테 주는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: Maybe let 'em be sad about something small before the really sad things happen.
translation.ko: 진짜 슬픈 일을 겪기 전에 면역력을 길러주려는 건지도요

translation.en: Come on.
And, you know, lizards have a really long lifespan.
Like, 20 years.
So what happened to Ricky?
Uh, well, his living situation wasn't exactly ideal either.
translation.ko: 그게 리키가 사는 꼴도 이상적이진 않았거든요

translation.en: -Ya know. -Whose is?
These guys'.
-Yeah. -[Danny] Hello.
Hello?
[Ellie] Hello?
-Where is she? -Yeah, and where's the dog?
translation.ko: - 어디 갔죠? - 그러게요, 개는 어디 있고요?

translation.en: Hey, look, someone's coming home.
I think that-- That's the guy with the SUV.
What?
Hide. Hide.
What are you doing? Come on.
-[whispers] We gotta jump. -What?
[whispers] We gotta jump.
[softly] We got this, okay?
Fuck.
[mouthing] Come on. Jump!
Come on.
We didn't let the dog out.
You know what? Look, I'm going back up there.
I'm going back up there.
I'm going to explain to them. Take my ID.
If I get arrested I'm gonna give a false name.
The name isn't the problem, you've been seen by half the family.
translation.ko: 이름이 문제가 아니라 저 가족이 그쪽 얼굴을 봤다고요

translation.en: Let's just wait till they go in the morning.
translation.ko: 내일 아침에 저 사람들이 나갈 때까지 기다리죠

translation.en: The wife will probably leave the briefcase inside, we'll go in and get it.
translation.ko: 부인이 서류 가방 놓고 가면 가져오면 되잖아요

translation.en: -And what if it's not there? -Then we'll leave, all right?
We just got to wait and see.
Look, I'm sorry, all right? I screwed up.
translation.ko: 저기요, 내가 일 망친 건 정말 미안해요

translation.en: It's my fault. I'm gonna forfeit my share, okay?
translation.ko: 내 잘못이라 받기로 한 돈도 못 받을 거예요

translation.en: -But I can't stay here the whole night. -No, you have to.
translation.ko: - 하지만 밤새 있을 순 없어요 - 있어야 해요

translation.en: Why? Why? And honestly, you should come with me.
We should let them deal with this.
This is-- This is their problem. This has nothing to do with us.
translation.ko: 우리 문제가 아니라 그 사람들 문제잖아요

translation.en: Unless you know how someone who's broke can make enough money
translation.ko: 돈 한 푼 없는 사람이 거지 같은 상황을 벗어날 만큼

translation.en: to get out of a shitty situation, then it's worth it to me.
translation.ko: 충분한 돈이 걸려 있으니 나한테는 중요해요

translation.en: Are you using the money to get away from that guy?
translation.ko: 이 돈으로 그 남자한테 벗어날 거예요?

translation.en: Yes, okay?
I'm using the money to leave Pittsburgh.
Okay.
Hey, uh...
good job back there.
You know, from not letting the dog out and stuff.
-You gonna order something? -Yeah, sure.
Um, what can we get for nine dollars?
Is that including tip?
Sure.
Can I use your phone?
-You have reached the voice mailbox of... -Scott.
-Please leave a message after the tone. -[beep]
translation.ko: 삐 소리가 난 후 메시지를 남겨주세요

translation.en: Hey, it's me.
We're fine, we're on it but we got delayed.
translation.ko: 일 처리 중인데 시간이 좀 걸리네요

translation.en: So it won't be going down till tomorrow.
So, yeah, we'll be at the motel in the morning.
-[Danny] So what'd he say? -Couldn't reach him.
All right, look, let's get some food.
You need food? I need food, I'm starving.
translation.ko: 배 안 고파요? 난 배고파 죽겠어요

translation.en: -Yeah? -All right, yeah.
Kids' menu or appetizers?
[Ellie] So what about you? You got a roommate, girlfriend?
translation.ko: 당신은 어때요? 룸메이트나 여자 친구 있어요?

translation.en: [Danny] Well, I was-- I was seeing this girl in my building last year.
translation.ko: 작년에 같은 건물에 살던 여자를 만나긴 했죠

translation.en: [Ellie] Oh, really? With that little hair thing above your lip?
What's wrong with my mustache?
All right, who else?
[Danny] I don't wanna talk about this with you. [Ellie] Come on, give me something.
translation.ko: - 말 안 할래요 - 얘기 좀 해 봐요

translation.en: Very bad for Darren?
Ma, it could be very bad for me.
[Ellie] What about high school?
Some scandalous hallway hookups? Some stairway action?
translation.ko: 복도에서 벌어진 추문이나 계단에서 있었던 사건 없어요?

translation.en: All right.
Rebecca Vargas. She touched my penis in tenth grade.
translation.ko: 레베카 바르가스가 고1 때 내 성기를 만졌죠

translation.en: -Wow. Rebecca Vargas? -Yeah, Rebecca Vargas.
Rebecca Vargas back then... Oh, my God, man.
Ohh. I don't know if it counts, though.
-[Ellie] Why wouldn't it count? -Well...
All right. Mike Budabin, a friend of mine,
he told everyone that whoever got Rebecca Vargas
to touch their penis first, wins the "Special Prize."
translation.ko: 첫 번째 사람이 특별 선물을 받는다고 떠들었죠

translation.en: [Ellie] What was the Special Prize?
It was having Rebecca Vargas touch your penis.
-Makes sense. -Right.
Anyway, she found out about this prize being associated with her
translation.ko: 어쨌든 레베카가 이 선물이 자기랑 연관된 걸 알고

translation.en: and she wanted to know what it was.
And so she asked me, and I said that I would tell her, but...
she had to touch my penis first.
So she tapped it with her pinky and...
translation.ko: 그래서 레베카가 내 그곳을 새끼손가락으로 건드렸고

translation.en: that's how I won the Special Prize.
[Ola, in Polish] Daniel, just come home now.
You'll make supper, and the bettors are coming early tomorrow.
translation.ko: 저녁도 만들어야 하고 내일 일찍 내기꾼들이 오잖니

translation.en: We should just let Darren handle it.
Yeah.
Daniel?
I'm gonna stay.
Daniel? Daniel? Hello?
Thank you.
[Ellie] I don't know if that's the sweetest or saddest story
translation.ko: 제가 들어본 중에 가장 달콤한 얘긴지

translation.en: I've ever heard in my life.
No, no, no, it's the sweetest. It's the sweetest.
For the record, it counts.
-Really? -Yeah, of course.
I mean, she touched your penis, right?
[Danny] You don't think that we should just sleep in the woods?
[Ellie scoffs] I am not sleeping in the woods.
-What if this is alarmed? -The pool shed?
-I don't know. -Don't worry. It's not alarmed.
translation.ko: - 혹시 모르잖아요 - 걱정하지 말아요, 안 울려요

translation.en: Just come on. Live a little.
translation.ko: 소심하게 굴지 말고 재미있게 좀 살아요

translation.en: [Danny] So he ends up going to court
and he was in the courtroom going "It was a ghost."
And the judge is like, "I know the ghost. I've seen it."
translation.ko: 그러자 판사가 자기도 그 유령을 봤다며 안다고 했죠

translation.en: So he got off.
So, what do you cook?
Everything.
-I mean, at the restaurant. -Oh. Um...
It's, uh, it's a nice little Italian place.
You ever been there? To Italy?
No. No.
I mean, the only place I've ever been is Providence.
Well, that's where you should go.
Forget Sacramento.
Yeah.
I've been there once.
-[Danny] You have? -To Italy, yeah.
Wow. Did you go with your family or something?
No.
-I'm sorry, I didn't... -Don't be sorry.
Do you like it there?
Yeah, I guess.
Italy has a lot of shady people once you get past all the tourist stuff.
Right.
You don't ever think that maybe it's-- it's not the place that's shady,
translation.ko: 그곳이 수상한 게 아니라 그쪽이 어울리는 사람들이

translation.en: it's the people you're choosing to hang out with.
You know, why don't you go somewhere else besides Providence for the weekend
translation.ko: 프로비던스 말고는 가본 곳도 없는 사람이

translation.en: before you start acting like you know everything.
-I'm sorry. -No, it's-- No, no, it's okay.
I'm just cold.
You know, if-- if you are cold, we could-- we could hold each other.
Excuse me?
You know, we could hold each other for warmth.
You wanna cuddle me?
Look, it's a meteorical fact. I'm not, you know.
Meteorological.
That's what I meant.
If you try anything, I swear to God you're gonna fuckin' regret it.
translation.ko: 무슨 짓이라도 하면 후회하게 해줄 거예요

translation.en: No, I'm-- I'm a little scared of you, so I'm not...
translation.ko: 당신 좀 무서워서 허튼짓 안 해요

translation.en: Okay.
Yeah?
We're only cuddling for warmth.
Yeah. Cuddling for weather purposes.
translation.ko: 네, 날씨 때문에 어쩔 수 없어서요

translation.en: [Ellie] Hey, it's me. We're fine. We're on it, but we got delayed.
translation.ko: 나예요, 일 처리 중인데 시간이 좀 걸리네요

translation.en: So it won't be going down till tomorrow.
So, yeah. We'll be at the motel in the morning.
So that was Ellie. And it's fine, you know.
Uh, they're a little delayed, but they'll be there in the morning, so...
translation.ko: 시간이 좀 걸려서 내일 모텔로 온대

translation.en: Just drop me off at the motel and it's all good.
What exactly is good about that?
It's, uh-- You know, she has it.
-She said that? -[Scott] Yeah.
Let me hear the message.
I deleted it.
She'll be there. I mean, she needs the money.
translation.ko: 모텔로 올 거야 돈이 필요한 애잖아

translation.en: I mean-- and she's gotta bring him too, or else she won't get his share, so...
translation.ko: 대런 몫을 차지하려고 녀석도 데려올 거야

translation.en: You know, it'll work out.
-Like it worked out in Camden? -That was three years ago, Jimmy.
Come on, man. [stammers]
Move on.
Yeah, maybe for you and me moving on is a good idea.
translation.ko: 너랑 일 그만하는 게 좋은 생각일지도 모르지

translation.en: -That-- That's not what I mean. -[cell phone vibrating]
It's Darren.
Darren, where are you, man?
[Darren] Hey, man, I'm-- I'm running a little late. I'm at my mom's house.
What do you mean you're at your mom's house?
[Darren] I, uh, got a little delayed. I'll be at-- I'll be at the motel soon.
Well, then, who the fuck is with Ellie?
[Ellie] All right, here they come.
Whoa. She's clearly running the family.
[Danny] Yeah, he looks like he'd be lost without her.
translation.ko: 남편은 아내 없인 길도 못 찾을 것 같아요

translation.en: [Ellie] And you know what he does when he's lost.
translation.ko: 저 남자가 길 잃으면 어떻게 하는지 알잖아요

translation.en: [both, in unison] Calls the police.
[Ellie] All right, hopefully she left the briefcase inside.
[Danny] Oh, no, no, no, no. That's not the woman with the green bag.
[Ellie] What do you mean?
[Danny] She was like, I don't know, 30 years younger.
-Are you sure? -Yeah.
Shit.
-[Danny] What if she locked it? -You just saw her not lock the door.
translation.ko: - 잠갔으면 어쩌죠? - 안 잠근 거 봤잖아요

translation.en: The whole point of living out here
translation.ko: 우리 같은 도둑 걱정 안 하려고

translation.en: is so they don't have to worry about people like us.
All right, all right.
-Hey! -Take it.
-Hey, is this her? -Yeah, that's her.
-I guess it's the daughter. -But she had the pills.
I don't know, they must be her mom's.
Come on.
There's a computer. Boom. All right.
translation.ko: 컴퓨터가 있을 텐데 여기 있네, 좋아요

translation.en: So, I just put their last name into their email
and-- and something should come up.
Wait, how do I spell it?
- W-E-I-R-E-- - I-R... Wierengo. I got it.
translation.ko: - W, E, I, R, E... - 위어렝고, 나왔네요

translation.en: All right.
We got Dave Wierengo, we got Eric Wierengo.
Vinessa Wierengo, with an "I" in the Vinessa.
- Where? - After the "V."
"Hey, Mom, do you remember the name of the hotel?"
Blah-blah-blah, blah-blah-blah... All right!
-What? -We got it.
"Vinessa Wierengo, Marketing Coordinator. Annabella Advisors, 242 West 30th Street."
-Oh, my God! -Yes! All right!
All right, I'm-- I'm gonna go change.
Why, what? What do you mean change?
Because I feel fuckin' filthy.
Just go grab some food.
-All right. Yeah. -Okay?
Let's do it!
Hey, you in there? We should probably get out of here.
[Ellie] Yeah. Just a minute.
[Ellie] Hey. Put this on.
Sure.
Come on. Let's go.
So, what do you think?
About what?
About my mustache.
Yeah, I don't know. Maybe you looked better with it.
You look great.
At least better than whatever was going on there before.
And I'm sure all the girls in your building will love it.
translation.ko: 그쪽이 사는 건물 여자들이 다 반하겠네요

translation.en: I don't want the girls in my building.
[Danny] Is my mom there?
Or can you put my brother on?
[Jimmy] They're fine. Just give me the address.
[Danny] Vinessa Wierengo, Annabella Advisors.
Vinessa Wierengo, Annabella Advisors.
-242 West 30th Street. -242 West 30th Street. Got it.
And that's-- that's with an "I" after the "V" in Vinessa.
It's not Vanessa.
-[Jimmy] Just sit tight. -Okay.
I'll send guys over. If she leaves, stay with her.
translation.ko: 사람을 보낼 테니 그 여자가 떠나면 붙어 있어

translation.en: [Danny] She wants to know about the money.
What about the money?
She'll get what we agreed to.
I want you to go to them, then meet Scott outside the motel.
translation.ko: 이 애들한테 가서 모텔 밖에서 스콧을 만나

translation.en: Oh, and Darren, what me and Ellie agreed to...
translation.ko: 대런, 나랑 엘리가 합의한 게 뭔지 알아?

translation.en: she's taking your share.
I gotta take a shit.
Uh, yeah, Annabella Advisors. Uh, 242 West 30th Street.
[man] Hello. Annabella Advisors.
Could you connect me with, uh, Vinessa Winergo, please?
-Uh, yes. Wierengo. Please hold. -[line ringing]
Hello, this is Vinessa.
Ms. Wierengo. Hi. Yeah. Um...
I believe you may have a briefcase that belongs to me.
translation.ko: 아마 제 서류 가방을 가지고 계실 것 같은데요

translation.en: [Vinessa] Oh. Oh, my God, yes.
I-- I'm-- I have it right here in my office. Do you have my bag?
translation.ko: 사무실에 있어요 제 가방 가지고 계시죠?

translation.en: Your bag? Yeah, I've got it.
Here's the thing, I'm about to walk into a very important meeting right now
translation.ko: 제가 지금 아주 중요한 회의에 가야 하는데

translation.en: and there are some essential documents in it that I need right now.
translation.ko: 그 가방에 있는 서류가 꼭 필요해요

translation.en: [Vinessa] Oh, well, I...
Look, it's a beautiful day outside. Why not get out of the office, right?
[Jimmy] No fucking way, Darren.
I don't care how long it takes, you're not running any errands.
translation.ko: 시간 좀 걸려도 상관없으니 이제 너한테는 일 안 맡겨

translation.en: Hello?
Sir, uh, we got the briefcase.
-[Jimmy] Really? -Yeah, yeah.
-How? -I-- I don't know.
She walked out of her building and she had the briefcase with her.
translation.ko: 그 여자가 서류 가방을 들고 사무실에서 나왔어요

translation.en: So we decided to follow her, right?
[Jimmy] All right, but I told you to just stay on her.
[Danny] Uh, yeah, yeah.
But then we started thinking like...
[Ellie] Where do you think she's going with it?
[Danny] I don't know. Do you think she's gonna go to the cops?
I don't know.
-[Jimmy] Yeah, that makes sense, I guess. -[Danny] Right?
So we decided to keep, uh, real close and-- and-- and watch her,
and we didn't take our eyes off her one bit.
[Ellie] She's getting up.
We gotta get that briefcase.
I'm wearing her mom's dress.
All right. Let me deal with it, all right?
-Hey. Hey! Hi. -Oh, hey.
Sorry, I don't know if you remember me but I got your bag.
translation.ko: 기억하실지 모르겠지만 그쪽 가방이 저한테 있어요

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, of course. Hi.
I'm really sorry, I just took it by mistake. It wasn't like--
No, no, I know. Don't worry. I got it. Here.
Right. Right.
-Thanks. -Thank you! Thank you so much.
I guess I'm gonna head back down here, but thank you.
-Good luck with your meeting. -Thank you.
She just gave-- She just gave it-- -She just gave it to me. -Let's go!
I didn't even say anything to her.
[Danny] We were real smart about it, too, like she didn't suspect a thing at all.
translation.ko: 우리가 너무 감쪽같아서 아무것도 의심 안 했나 봐요

translation.en: [Jimmy] All right. I don't need to hear the whole story.
translation.ko: 됐어 구구절절이 설명 안 해도 돼

translation.en: Just meet outside the motel.
Okay. Um, sir, can I talk to my brother, please?
translation.ko: 알았어요, 선생님 형과 통화할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: They want us to meet at the motel.
-They got the briefcase. -What?
Looks like you're a lucky son of a bitch.
-[Danny] Darren? -Yeah.
We got the briefcase, man. We came through.
Are you there with the girl? Talk in Polish.
translation.ko: 그 여자애랑 같이 있어? 폴란드어로 얘기해

translation.en: [Danny, in Polish] Yeah.
[in English] Thank fucking God.
[in Polish] Listen, she's screwing us over.
translation.ko: 잘 들어, 그 여자애가 우리를 엿 먹이려고 해

translation.en: [Danny] What? No, she's not.
She cut a deal with them. She gets my share...
translation.ko: 저 사람들하고 흥정해서 일이 끝날 때까지

translation.en: if she babysits you until it's done.
translation.ko: 널 데리고 다니면 내 몫까지 가져가기로 했어

translation.en: No, no. She's really cool.
[Darren, in English] Listen, Danny, I know you probably like her and all,
translation.ko: 잘 들어 대니 네가 걔한테 빠졌는진 모르겠지만

translation.en: but think about it.
I bet she was real insistent on you sticking around the whole time, right?
Why do you think she would do that?
You there, kid?
[in Polish] Yeah.
[Darren] Look, I'm sorry, Danny.
She's a con artist. Stripper.
[in Polish] Waitress.
[Darren, in English] Yeah, whatever, man.
Point is, you're a fucking paycheck to her.
translation.ko: 요점은 넌 그냥 걔한테 돈줄이라는 거야

translation.en: But if you bring the briefcase back,
then I can get the whole share and cut her out of it.
translation.ko: 그 여자애 몫까지 내가 다 챙길 수 있어

translation.en: Danny?
[in Polish] Just get the briefcase and come home.
All right?
[in Polish] Yeah.
[Ellie] You speak Russian?
Polish.
Then I figured out we were-- we were sneaking in at intermission.
translation.ko: 그러다 중간휴식 때 몰래 들어간 걸 알았죠

translation.en: I don't know, I kind of preferred it that way, though.
What's wrong?
Nothing.
What?
-Come on, tell me what's up. -I got fired, all right?
They called my mom.
Darren just told me. It doesn't matter.
I'm sorry.
I missed my shift, it happens.
It doesn't matter.
Wait. Wait, wait, wait, wait. Listen.
I was thinking that when we get to the motel...
you should just wait nearby.
All right? Let me go up there alone and handle it. I got it.
Look, I'm gonna call my manager, all right?
Okay? I just wanna see what she's saying. I don't wanna...
Just give me a minute?
Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah. Sure.
[man] Miss, you got a Metro card?
No. I just gotta get my bag.
-Danny. -Hey, Mom.
You didn't bring the--
You didn't bring the fucking briefcase?
Are you fucking kidding me, Danny?
[punching his palm] Are you fucking kidding me?
-It's fucking funny to you, man? -Yeah.
Scott.
[Scott] Ellie.
-Hey! I tried to call you. I tried to-- -Yeah, yeah.
Yeah, yeah.
Hey.
Hey. Hey.
That girl...
She isn't gonna leave anybody.
Even if she thinks she is.
She isn't.
Trust me.
What did you say? Huh?
-What are you saying to me? -Fuck you.
That's what I'm saying.
-Russell, where are we going? -I don't know. To some rich lady.
translation.ko: - 러셀, 어디로 가요? - 몰라, 돈 많은 부인한테

translation.en: Ma! Leave it. Just leave it, okay? Leave it.
-I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. -[speaking in Polish]
Ma.
[woman] Come in.
Come in. You can-- You can put that down.
Right there.
Very good.
Sit.
You wanna know the combination?
Zero-zero-zero.
It's about the only thing these guys did that wasn't Byzantine in its complexity.
translation.ko: 이 남자들이 했던 일 중 단순한 건 이게 유일할 거예요

translation.en: [gasps] But you know how some men are.
They think the more intricate they make something, the more impressive it is.
translation.ko: 뭔가를 복잡하게 만들수록 더 인상적이라고 생각하죠

translation.en: Ah, there you are.
The one thing the lawyer said I couldn't get.
translation.ko: 변호사가 내가 못 가진다고 한 유일한 물건인데

translation.en: And I got it.
[sighs] I want to tell you something:
Never marry a man who doesn't love his mother.
translation.ko: 자기 엄마를 사랑하지 않는 남자와는 절대 결혼하지 말아요

translation.en: There's $3,000 in that envelope.
Thank you.
You can-- You can leave.
And I'll let Jimmy know it's done so everyone else can get paid.
translation.ko: 다들 돈 받을 수 있게 지미한테 일 끝났다고 얘기할게요

translation.en: Okay.
[Russell] So where we going?
Not today. We're not open.
-[knock at door] -We're just-- We're gonna--
[Ola] Who are you?
I'm, uh...
-I'm Rebecca Vargas. -[mother] Rebecca Vargas?
-Yeah? -[mother speaking in Polish]
Yeah, we went to high school together, Ma. You don't remember?
translation.ko: 네, 고등학교 동창인데 기억 안 나요?

translation.en: Hey.
Don't spend it all at the club.
Take it. And don't give it to your brother.
So where are you gonna go?
Bus to Pittsburgh.
Yeah?
I thought you said you were gonna leave there.
I am.
I just...
-I... -[scoffs]
-I owe it to him. -Yeah.
Right.
Just wait.
Just wait.
You know, you know, you don't...
You need a Metro card.
I-- I think I can buy one.
You can't because you only have hundreds
and those machines are crappy and-- and I wanna give you...
translation.ko: 카드 파는 기계가 형편없고... 내가 주고 싶어서요

translation.en: my Metro card.
Thanks.
...two, three, four, five.
Ma, Ma.
Sir, sir, I'll give you $100-- 100 for your card.
Whoa. How do I know that's not counterfeit?
It's not.
Give me a swipe, give me a swipe.
-One swipe. -One swipe.
Thanks.
Hi. When's the next bus to Pittsburgh?
Uh... 6:40 p.m. The ticket is $57.
-[woman] Miss? -Yeah, uh-- never mind, actually.
When's the next bus to Providence?
Sorry! Sorry, sorry! Sorry.
Hey! Hey!
I-- I didn't think you...
[panting] Look. Look.
I was gonna go and I-- and I just-- I just ran all the way here.
What's going on?
Look...
I want to go to Pittsburgh with you.
I'm not going to Pittsburgh.
Well, where you going?
Providence.
Yeah?
Can I come with you?
Yeah. Sure.
Yeah?
-Yeah. -Yeah?
Wait.
-I'm sorry, okay? I shouldn't have-- -It's okay.
-It's okay. -No, no, I shouldn't have done that.
